turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Blue-naped parrot.
turn.1: What is the difference between a cockatoo, a love bird, and a parrot?
turn.2: Blue-naped parrot The blue-naped parrot ("Tanygnathus lucionensis"), also known as the blue-crowned green parrot, Luzon parrot, the Philippine green parrot, and locally known as pikoy, is a parrot found throughout the Philippines.
turn.3: When was the first one discovered?
turn.4: In 1760 the French zoologist Mathurin Jacques Brisson included a description of the blue-naped parrot in his "Ornithologie" based on a specimen collected on the island of Luzon in the Philippines.
turn.5: What did it call the bird?
turn.6: He used the French name "Le perroquet de l'Isle de Luçon" and the Latin name "Psittacus lucionensis".
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: Although Brisson coined Latin names, these do not conform to the binomial system and are not recognised by the International Commission on Zoological Nomenclature.
turn.9: Why did he use that name?
turn.10: When in 1766 the Swedish naturalist Carl Linnaeus updated his "Systema Naturae" for the twelfth edition he added 240 species that had been previously described by Brisson.
turn.11: What was one of the species?
turn.12: One of these was the blue-naped parrot.
